info.abstract:
The Intervention Effects component helps you analyze data for the intervention effects.
See demo workflow.
info.description: This component allows you to analyze data for the intervention effects.
info.inputs: A tab-delimited or comma-separated text file: contains data to be analyzed.

ul.li: A text file with data summary and linear modeling result
A pdf file with analysis result plots
Student Column: choose the column with student ID.
Had Intervention Column: choose the column that depicts if the student is in the intervention group. The allowed values are 0 and 1: 0 for control group and 1 for intervention group.
Pre Post Intervention Column: choose the column that depicts if data in the row happened pre or post intervention. The allowed values are 0 and 1: 0 for pre-intervention and 1 for post-intervention.
Number of Measurements: how many measurements you want to analyze. Enter integer 1 to 5.
Measurement N Column: choose the column for measurement. Only numeric data is allowed in the column.

Faceting Group for Measurement N: choose "Had intervention" or "Pre and post intervention". "Had intervention" plots comparison of pre- and post-intervention with control and intervention condition as faceting groups. "Pre and post intervention" plots comparison of control and intervention condition with pre- and post-intervention as faceting groups.

p.b: To analyze the effect of intervention on number of infractions and miscondtions:

ol.li: Pre Post Intervention Column: choose "postIntervention" column.
Faceting Group for Measurement 1: choose "Pre and post intervention".
Faceting Group for Measurement 2: choose "Pre and post intervention".
